items.sentence: I\'ve made the same mistakes as I made last time.
I\'ve told you a million times not to exaggerate.
If he doesn\'t accept the job, someone else will.
I didn\'t have time to eat lunch, so I\'m hungry.
It\'s OK to eat the rest of the cake if you want.
I wonder what I should get you for your birthday.
Tom will do that for you if you ask him politely.
Tom will have to work late every night this week.
Tom will very likely be punished for what he did.
I miss you. I need to see you. Could I come over?
I never thought something like that could happen.
Tom came into the building, carrying a heavy box.
Tom came into the house, carrying his skateboard.
Tom can play "Red River Valley" on the harmonica.
Tom can play tennis better than anyone else here.
Tom can speak both French and English quite well.
We have more important things we need to discuss.
We reserve the right to refuse service to anyone.
We saved a lot of time by going down Park Street.
There are many words with meanings I don\'t know.
You\'re the only person who shows me any respect.
You\'re wasting your time trying to convince Tom.
You\'ve got to give up gambling once and for all.
A doctor told me that eating eggs was bad for me.
A leap year has three hundred and sixty-six days.
A number of cars are parked in front of my house.
I didn\'t mean to eavesdrop on your conversation.
I didn\'t pay attention to what they were saying.
I didn\'t tell my girlfriend anything about this.
I didn\'t think it would be that easy to do that.
I didn\'t understand half of what Tom was saying.
I didn\'t want to leave without saying thank you.
Tom has attempted to escape at least three times.
Tom likes the same kind of stuff that Mary likes.
I can\'t see you without thinking of your mother.
I can\'t stop thinking about what they did to me.
I couldn\'t attend that party because I was sick.
Tom and Mary were both in Boston all last summer.
Tom and Mary were working together all last week.
Tom and Mary will play tennis tomorrow afternoon.
Tom and his brother have different personalities.
Tom and his friends discussed politics all night.
Tom and his friends played baseball last weekend.
Tom is planning to get up early tomorrow morning.
Tom is probably going to be back by October 20th.
Tom is saving up money so he can go to Australia.
Tom is scheduled to appear in court October 20th.
Tom is scheduled to be sentenced on October 20th.
Tom is seriously thinking about moving to Boston.
Tom doesn\'t have to stay if he doesn\'t want to.
